title: VEGOILS-Palm rises around 1% on stronger overnight soyoil
text:
VEGOILS-Palm rises around 1% on stronger overnight soyoil

KUALA LUMPUR, Sept 4 (Reuters) - Malaysian palm oil futures rose in early trade on Wednesday, lifted by gains in overnight prices of soyoil on the Chicago Board of Trade (CBOT).

The benchmark palm oil contract for November delivery FCPOc3 on the Bursa Malaysia Derivatives Exchange was last up 0.9% at 2,202 ringgit ($525.54) per tonne.

In related oils, U.S. soyoil futures on the Chicago Board of Trade BOc2 had jumped 1.1% on Tuesday, but were last down 0.6% on Wednesday.

FUNDAMENTALS

* U.S. wheat futures rallied nearly 1% on Wednesday, rebounding from a near four-month low touched in the previous session, as the U.S. Department of Agriculture pegged the pace of the harvest behind market expectations. GRA/

* Oil prices fell on Tuesday, with futures down 2% after manufacturing data raised concerns about a weakening global economy, while the U.S.-China trade dispute continued to drag on investor sentiment. O/R

MARKET NEWS

* Asian stocks bounced on Wednesday, led by Chinese markets after a report showed growth in the country's service sector accelerating despite broader economic headwinds, while the pound halted its decline on hopes a no-deal Brexit may yet be averted. MKTS/GLOB

* U.S. stocks fell on Tuesday as investors worried about global growth prospects after data showed U.S. factory activity shrank in August for the first time since 2016 and the United States and China imposed new tariffs on each other over the weekend. .N

* The dollar pulled back on Wednesday as weak U.S. manufacturing stoked wagers on aggressive policy easing, while the British pound recouped losses in the wake of a parliamentary vote that opened the door for another Brexit delay. USD/
